content.description: varied face climbing up good rock.  getting in pro above last bolt is strenuous and difficult.
content.protection: 4 bolts, nuts, and mid size cams.  2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: 30ish feet left of 'Tang'.  2 bolt anchor with rings at the top.

content.description: Directly left of Tang is an adjacent black face with two bolts. Get a few mid to large size cams after the bolts and pull a fun flat roof at mid height. Negotiate a tough upper headwall to get your treat.
content.protection: Mostly sport but need a couple cams.
content.location: Left of 'The Great Taste Of Tang', starting up the black face.

content.description:
This route isn't necessarily completely straightforward but it climbs really well and should probably get done more often. The trail now goes directly underneath of 'Dragon' instead of stopping at Tang so it is much more accessible. For years this had a different name but Shelley liked Dragon best.

Ten feet right of Electric Kool-Aid Test, climb the crack that leads to much lower angle rock. In the lower angle section, there are hidden gear placements out right that should be used but make sure to continue trending your climbing towards the left. At 2/3 height follow the steep mini-dihedral through the upper headwall past a bolt. Trend left to the anchors of Kool-Aid Test. Bring a rack of all sizes.
content.location: Ten feet left of Electric Kool-Aid Test where the trail now hugs the cliff.

content.description: Climb past some gear to a mixed line of bolts leading up the steep orange colored bilboard wall.

content.location: Just left of Great Taste Of Tang

content.description: From the ledge, climb up the center of the face staying slightly left of the bolt line to the forth bolt. Traverse a few feet right and up the corner to anchors under the roof.
content.location:
This climb is located in a corner and up on a ledge called The Chicken Ledge.

Left of Sleeping Above the Kitchen, the cliff forms a corner. Boulder 20' up a low angle but potentially dicey face to a ledge big enough for one party. Finger Lick'n climbs the center of the face.

content.description: On the right side of the orange wall, work your way around the right side of a bolt on the low arete. Get some small gear on the middle face and fire a powerful crux up the center of the first roof and a finish crux the center of the top roof.
content.location: Route to the right of Tang on the large orange wall.

content.description: Start at the center of the face and clip the first bolt of Finger Lick'n Good on a 24' runner. This way if you slip on the unprotected traverse, you won't bounce all the way down the short wall beneath you pulling your belayer in tow. Make the traverse out left through a couple thin Â moves to the base of a vertical crack and plug cams and/or nuts of all sizes to finish through a slot in the roof above. Belay from the top and rap down.
content.location:
This climb is located in a corner and up on a ledge called The Chicken Ledge.

Left of Sleeping Above the Kitchen, the cliff forms a corner. Boulder 20' up easy but protectable terrain with one sketchy spot to a ledge big enough for one party. Chicken Fingers is the splitter crack to the left.
